column4: I just installed ubuntu 8.10, but kept my /home folder from 8.04, I deleted my /home/user/. directories. I can no longer see an icon for wireless networks. I created a new user and can see it there. How do I get it back for my current user?

System > Preferences > Sessions, then "Startup Programs" tab. There should be an entry for Network Manager. Check the box by it. If the entry isn't there, let me know and I'll walk you through adding it.
network manager has a check in it already
but it's not loading up? hmm. Select it, then hit Edit, and paste the contents of the "Command" field here.
nm-applet --sm-disable
hmm. and it's still not running? that's odd...
looking at ps, there is no program called nm-applet running, but I can see my wireless connections in my newly created user account
ps or ps -A?
ps -aux

ah, tried running from the command line, I get this error: WARNING **: <WARN>  applet_dbus_manager_start_service(): Could not acquire the NetworkManagerUserSettings service as it is already taken.  Return: 3
okay. So on the user account you grabbed from hardy, you see Network Manager in Sessions, and it's checked, but isn't running?
that is correct
maybe try only logging into one user at a time? it might be complicating things...
yeah, the reason I created the other user was because I couldn't find a way to connect to my wireless network from this account
oh, yeah, huh, it'll disconnect you.
okays, give me a second to think about it
okay thanks

okay. Try logging out of both your users, then logging into the broken one. If the applet doesn't show up, issue nm-applet from the terminal and see if it shows up. If it still doesn't show up, do sudo /etc/init.d/NetworkManager stop then sudo /etc/init.d/NetworkManager start from the terminal. If it /still/ doesn't work, give up, log into your working user, and install wicd because I'm out of ideas.
(wicd is, for me at least, incredibly less annoying than NM :) )
thanks, will give it a try, should I also issue --sm-disable with the nm-applet command?
doesn't matter
